condition.description:
Insomnia is a common sleep disorder. If you have it, you may have trouble falling asleep, staying asleep, or both. As a result, you may get too little sleep or have poor-quality sleep. You may not feel refreshed when you wake up.

Symptoms of insomnia include:

  • Lying awake for a long time before you fall asleep
  • Sleeping for only short periods
  • Being awake for much of the night
  • Feeling as if you haven't slept at all
  • Waking up too early

Your doctor will diagnose insomnia based on your medical and sleep histories and a physical exam. He or she also may recommend a sleep study. A sleep study measures how well you sleep and how your body responds to sleep problems. Treatments include lifestyle changes, counseling, and medicines.

NIH: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute

basics.benefits_moa: Advil PM is a combination medicine that treats cold and flu symptoms. Ibuprofen is an NSAID that relieves pain and reduces fever. Diphenhydramine is an antihistamine that treats runny nose and watery eyes and helps you sleep.
basics.bottom_line: Advil PM works well at relieving pain and also helps you sleep.
downsides: The pain reliever (ibuprofen) can interact with other medications and make health problems like stomach bleeding and ulcers worse.
The antihistamine (diphenhydramine) can make you feel groggy the next morning.
Can only take one dose in 24 hours.
Can increase the risk of falls, so elderly people shouldn't use it.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Advil PM contains aspirin, which can cause serious problems including inflammation, bleeding, and ulcers in the stomach or intestines. The longer you take Advil PM, the higher the risk is. If you notice blood or a dark/black color in your stool, tell your doctor right away.
risk_factors: History of stomach bleeding or ulcers
Taking aspirin, NSAIDs, or blood thinners
Drinking more than 3 alcoholic beverages a day

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Advil PM can harm unborn babies. Ibuprofen can increase the risk of a heart defect in an unborn baby if you take it during the last 3 months of pregnancy (last trimester). Talk with your doctor or pharmacist about what's safe and will work best for you while pregnant.

description_processed.orig: Advil PM can harm unborn babies. Ibuprofen can increase the risk of a heart defect in an unborn baby if you take it during the last 3 months of pregnancy (last trimester). Talk with your doctor or pharmacist about what's safe and will work best for you while pregnant.

risks_warnings.title: Heart attack or stroke
risks_warnings.description: Advil PM contains ibuprofen, a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID). It can lower the benefit of low-dose aspirin (81 mg/day) in people taking it to prevent heart attacks and stroke, especially if taking both drugs together for a long time. If you take aspirin every day, take Advil PM more than 8 hours before your aspirin dose and at least 30 minutes after your aspirin dose to lower this risk.

risks_warnings.title: Heart failure
risks_warnings.description: Advil PM contains ibuprofen, an NSAID. NSAIDs can increase the risk of fluid buildup and swelling in the limbs. This can worsen heart failure, so the American Heart Association recommends that older people with heart failure and reduced heart function avoid taking NSAIDs.

basics.benefits_moa: Ativan is a fast-acting benzodiazepine. It affects neurotransmitters in the brain and calms the nervous system. This reduces anxiety and can cause sleepiness.
basics.bottom_line: Ativan is okay for occasional or short-term use (up to 4 weeks) for anxiety and sleep. Less likely to have drug interactions, but more likely to cause withdrawal symptoms compared to similar drugs.
downsides: Can cause memory problems, drowsiness, dizziness, and confusion.
Can be habit-forming, so it's not typically used for long-term treatment, or for people who've had problems with drug or alcohol abuse.
Compared to other benzodiazepines, more likely to cause withdrawal if you take it for a long time and then stop suddenly.
Most people find that it gets less effective over time.

risks_warnings.title: Tolerance and dependence
risks_warnings.description: If you use Ativan for 4 weeks or more, it's likely that your body will develop tolerance to it, which means that more and more of the medication is needed to achieve the same effect. You're also likely to become physically dependent on the medication, which means that you'll feel withdrawal symptoms if you stop taking it all at once. You can avoid withdrawal by weaning off of the medication very slowly with the help of a doctor. Take only the prescribed dose to minimize risks of abuse and overdose. Ativan should not be used by people with a history of drug abuse if an alternative medication is available.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Ativan suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and muscle pain or burning. Withdrawal symptoms can last 6 weeks or longer. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

risks_warnings.description: Ativan can harm a developing fetus. The baby can become dependent on the medicine and go through withdrawal after birth. Don't use Ativan while pregnant.

downsides: Benadryl makes you more tired than Claritin, Allegra, or Zyrtec.

risks_warnings.title: Overdose
risks_warnings.description: There are a variety of over-the-counter medications with the same ingredients as Benadryl. It's not safe to use more than one medication containing diphenhydramine (the ingredient in Benadryl) at the same time. Read package labels carefully to make sure you take the right dose of these medications.

risks_warnings.title: Increased side effects
risks_warnings.description: People age 65 years and older have a higher risk of side effects from taking antihistamine medications like Benadryl. Watch for changes in vision, severe dry mouth, trouble urinating, or constipation. The drowsiness caused by Benadryl can make you "unsteady" on your feet, leading to a higher chance of falls.

risks_warnings.title: Tolerance and dependence
risks_warnings.description: If you use Temazepam for 4 weeks or more, it's likely that your body will develop tolerance to it, which means that more and more of the medication is needed to achieve the same effect. You're also likely to become physically dependent on the medication, meaning you'll feel withdrawal symptoms if you stop taking it all at once. You can avoid withdrawal by weaning off of the medication very slowly with the help of a doctor. Take only the prescribed dose to minimize risks of abuse and overdose. Temazepam shouldn't be used by people with a history of drug abuse if an alternative medication is available.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Temazepam suddenly can cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and muscle pain or burning. Withdrawal symptoms can last 6 weeks or longer. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus

carousel_items: Promethazine comes in different forms. Be clear on which one you were prescribed - swallow tablets orally, unwrap and insert suppositories rectally.
Don't give to kids 2 and under.
You'll likely feel very sleepy, sluggish, or less alert after taking Promethazine. Avoid driving or other tasks that require your focused attention; be safe.
Don't drink alcohol to avoid intense side effects.
Taking certain medications for pain, allergies, or mood conditions can worsen the side effects of Promethazine.
Avoid using if you experience seizures (epilepsy).
Don't use if you're 65 or older because you're at higher risk for serious side effects.

basics.benefits_moa: Promethazine is an antihistamine, which helps control allergies. It also seems to block your body's natural reflex for vomiting, which makes it useful as an antiemetic (anti-nausea medicine).
basics.bottom_line: Promethazine is used to treat and prevent nausea and vomiting from surgery, motion sickness, or pregnancy. While it's cheap and available in different forms to make it easier to take, it can make you feel very sleepy, and its side effects mean that children under 2 and adults over 65 shouldn't take it.
downsides: Can make you feel very sleepy, especially if you're taking other drugs that can make you sleepy or if you drink alcohol.
Can't be used in children under 2 years of age or if you're over 65 because of increased risk from side effects.
Can make your skin more sensitive to the sun.

downsides_processed.orig: Can make you feel very sleepy, especially if you're taking other drugs that can make you sleepy or if you drink alcohol.
Can't be used in children under 2 years of age or if you're over 65 because of increased risk from side effects.

upsides: Available in generic.
Available as a syrup or tablet that you can take by mouth, or as a rectal suppository if you're unable to take anything by mouth.

risks_warnings.title: Slowing or stopping of breathing
risks_warnings.description: It's not recommended for children and teenagers, especially under the age of 2, to take Promethazine. There are reports of children whose breathing has slowed down after taking Promethazine, and some have died, especially if they were taking other medications that also slow down breathing.

description_processed.orig: It's not recommended for children and teenagers, especially under the age of 2, to take Promethazine. There are reports of children whose breathing has slowed down after taking Promethazine, and some have died, especially if they were taking other medications that also slow down breathing.

risks_warnings.title: Seizures
risks_warnings.description: If you've ever had seizures, taking Promethazine can make you more likely to have them. Talk to your doctor if this is a concern, or if you're taking medications to control your seizures since they may need to change the dose.

description_processed.orig: If you've ever had seizures, taking Promethazine can make you more likely to have them. Talk to your doctor if this is a concern, or if you're taking medications to control your seizures since they may need to change the dose.

risks_warnings.title: Sunburn
risks_warnings.description: Taking Promethazine can make your skin more sensitive to the sun, and more likely to have sunburn. Avoid being out in the sun for extended periods of time, or wear sunblock or protective clothing if you have to be out.

description_processed.orig: Taking Promethazine can make your skin more sensitive to the sun, and more likely to have sunburn. Avoid being out in the sun for extended periods of time, or wear sunblock or protective clothing if you have to be out.

risks_warnings.title: Involuntary muscle movements
risks_warnings.description: Talk to your doctor right away if you find that you're unable to control your movements (tremors, jerky movements of your arms or legs while walking, trouble swallowing or talking) while you're on Promethazine.  Your nervous system can be affected by taking this medication, especially if you're taking it for a long time. This is very rare.

description_processed.orig: Talk to your doctor right away if you find that you're unable to control your movements (tremors, jerky movements of your arms or legs while walking, trouble swallowing or talking) while you're on Promethazine. risks_warnings.title: Neuroleptic malignant syndrome
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of people taking Promethazine who have developed a condition called neuroleptic malignant syndrome. This is extremely rare. Call your doctor immediately if you develop a very high fever, your muscles become very stiff, an irregular pulse, or a lot of sweating.

basics.benefits_moa: Ambien is in a class of drugs called sedative-hypnotics. Researchers don't know exactly how it works, but it interacts with your brain to make you relaxed and sleepy.
basics.bottom_line: Ambien is good for falling asleep and staying asleep, but it can be habit-forming and might be more likely than other sleep medicines to cause disturbing side effects.
downsides: Not typically used for long-term treatment because it can be habit-forming.
Some people find that it's less effective over time.
More likely to cause sleep-walking, sleep-driving, and sleep-eating.
Might not be safe if you have problems with your liver, kidneys, or lungs, or if you have a history of depression.
It's easy to become reliant on sleep medicines. In the long run, it's better to learn good sleeping habits and behavior so that you can sleep better naturally.

risks_warnings.title: Dependence and withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: All prescription sleep-aid medicines like Ambien have a risk of physical dependence. Dependence means that you'll feel withdrawal symptoms if you stop taking the medication all at once. Talk to your doctor about natural ways to improve sleep or treat underlying conditions that prevent sleep.
risk_factors: Continuous use for 2 weeks or more

description_processed.orig: All prescription sleep-aid medicines like Ambien have a risk of physical dependence. Dependence means that you'll feel withdrawal symptoms if you stop taking the medication all at once. risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Ambien impairs your ability to focus, think, and react. These effects can extend to the morning after taking Ambien. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

risks_warnings.title: Sleep driving

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Ambien can cause serious allergic reactions and life-threatening organ failure. Report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Ambien can cause serious allergic reactions and life-threatening organ failure. Report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Disease interactions
risks_warnings.description: Let your doctor know before you start taking Ambien if you have breathing conditions, problems with your liver or been diagnosed with a muscle condition. Ambien may worsen your symptoms and you may need to take a lower dose.

description_processed.orig: Let your doctor know before you start taking Ambien if you have breathing conditions, problems with your liver or been diagnosed with a muscle condition. Ambien may worsen your symptoms and you may need to take a lower dose.

risks_warnings.title: Risk of falls and injury
risks_warnings.description: Ambien make you feel drowsy and sleepy, leading to falls and severe injuries. This is especially a risk if your older. Falls from sleep medicines like Ambien have caused severe injuries such as hip fractures and head injury. You may need a lower dose if you're taking other medicine that affects your nervous system or have issues with falls in the past. Check with your doctor first.
risk_factors: Taking Ambien with other nervous system depressants

description_processed.orig: Ambien make you feel drowsy and sleepy, leading to falls and severe injuries. This is especially a risk if your older. Falls from sleep medicines like Ambien have caused severe injuries such as hip fractures and head injury. You may need a lower dose if you're taking other medicine that affects your nervous system or have issues with falls in the past. Check with your doctor first.

risks_warnings.title: Risk to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Ambien can harm your unborn baby. It can cause severe lack of oxygen to the body (respiratory depression). The risk is higher the later you are in your pregnancy, especially if taking other nervous system depressants. It's not safe to take medicines like Ambien while pregnant, since your baby may be at risk for withdrawal and other serious side effects. Since it only takes a small amount of medicine to be significant in your baby’s body don't take Ambien if you're breast-feeding.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Ambien impairs your ability to focus, think, and react. These effects can extend to the morning after taking Ambien. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Ambien impairs your ability to focus, think, and react. These effects can extend to the morning after taking Ambien. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Abnormal thoughts
risks_warnings.description: Ambien can be disinhibiting (like alcohol) or cause hallucinations. Tell your doctor if you notice any unusual changes in behavior.

description_processed.orig: Ambien can be disinhibiting (like alcohol) or cause hallucinations. Tell your doctor if you notice any unusual changes in behavior.

risks_warnings.title: Sleep driving
risks_warnings.description: Ambien increases your risk of performing potentially dangerous activities while asleep, such as sleep-walking, sleep-driving, and sleep-eating. Talk to your doctor immediately about stopping Ambien if any sleep-related activities occur.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Ambien can cause serious allergic reactions and life-threatening organ failure. Report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Ambien can cause serious allergic reactions and life-threatening organ failure. Report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Disease interactions
risks_warnings.description: Let your doctor know before you start taking Ambien if you have breathing conditions, problems with your liver or been diagnosed with a muscle condition. Ambien may worsen your symptoms and you may need to take a lower dose.

description_processed.orig: Let your doctor know before you start taking Ambien if you have breathing conditions, problems with your liver or been diagnosed with a muscle condition. Ambien may worsen your symptoms and you may need to take a lower dose.

risks_warnings.title: Risk of falls and injury
risks_warnings.description: Ambien make you feel drowsy and sleepy, leading to falls and severe injuries. This is especially a risk if your older. Falls from sleep medicines like Ambien have caused severe injuries such as hip fractures and head injury. You may need a lower dose if you're taking other medicine that affects your nervous system or have issues with falls in the past. Check with your doctor first.
risk_factors: Taking Ambien with other nervous system depressants

risks_warnings.title: Risk to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Ambien can harm your unborn baby. It can cause severe lack of oxygen to the body (respiratory depression). The risk is higher the later you are in your pregnancy, especially if taking other nervous system depressants. It's not safe to take medicines like Ambien while pregnant, since your baby may be at risk for withdrawal and other serious side effects. Since it only takes a small amount of medicine to be significant in your baby’s body don't take Ambien if you're breast-feeding.

surveys.tip: No food or drinks after 7pm or at least 4 hours before going to bed

surveys.tip: Take 3 teaspoons of tart pitted cherries canned in water just prior to going to bed.
surveys.question: What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?

surveys.tip: I try not to go to bed too early.  Makes it more likely that i'll wake up too soon and not be able to fall back asleep
surveys.question: Besides medications, what else has worked for you?

surveys.tip: Don't stress about all the ripple effects.  One day at a time.
surveys.question: What’s your best coping strategy?

surveys.tip: Oddly enough, everything they say not to do.  I'm much better off watching TV from bed than almost anything else.  If i put the sleep timer on, and watch something silly, i get to sleep quickly and sleep longer
